comment.text: For many many years I have been a great believer it traditional Chinese medicine. Not just acupuncture. If it's been going for 3000 years there must be something to it. I had eczema on my leg and tried all the creams my doctor prescribed to no avail. Then I tried a Chinese remedy. It disappeared completely within a week and has not come back. That was eight years ago.

Thank you, Charmian! I have to say that this is one of the best motivational ted talks I have seen. You also point out 2 different features such as the art is all your patient not only by this disease, the second is ego in western medicine may keep the patient far away to them, we can be lost the physical interaction and mindful connection to them so many cases can't cure efficiently. Thank you! Good luck!

She actually has a quite accurate description of what "Qi" really means. No, it's not an energy, nor a field, nor a force. It is perhaps at best described as a pattern. One analogy would be with economy. There isn't a physical thing that constitutes economic boom or recession, but a pattern of the entire system.

My nephew's urticaria was 100% cured by TCM(Tradtional Chinese Medicine). He's been cured of it for 3 years now. From what I've read of conventional western medical treatment of urticaria, they would have him on daily Zyrtec pills. In a few years it would fail, then he would take monthly Xolair shots, then that would fail and he would end up in ER and given Prednisone steroid shots, but that would eventually fail too. I'm so glad we tried TCM. It only took two months and only $170 with TCM.

The biggest evidence for the effectiveness of Chinese medicine that anybody can observe I think is that the country with the biggest population whether now or in ancient times relies on this medical system for the most of its history. If it doesn't work, there wouldn't be so many people then. It's a system based on 3000 years of experience. Some rationale is there and working even the current science can't explain for now. And I think one reason for the lack of CURRENT science base of Chinese medicine is the lack of interest and real research which costs.

The application and knowledge really needs to be combined into modern medicine so that instead of relying solely on extremely expensive synthetic drugs, more research can be put into TCM with a combination of modern medical practices and some drugs.

I am trained in Chinese medicine, but not nearly as much as the doctors who work in China. I have been to China twice and practiced in three different hospitals. It is amazingly fascinating to see how they work and the result is absolutely fantastic. It is distressing when you meet, e.g. Swedes, who think it's just a placebo, or some other hocus pocus explanation. I mean this is in harmony with nature's healing.

Wow this Documentary unlocked a whole memory from my childhood. When I was around 6 or 7 I had a huge bloated stomach at all times and up to that point had been that way my whole life.  My parents couldn't figure it out....doctors said it was lactose intolerance...so my parents made adjustments to my diet and still my stomach was bloated.  I remember finally my dad took me to a TCM doctor, really strange when I think back on it as this was not something my dad was likely to do.

what a beautiful country China is...i have always admired the ancient beauty of China....i don't why I'm so attracted to Chinese traditional music...it's like a lullaby to my soul, it's like a heavenly mist that comforts my soul and I'm so at peace every time i hear Chinese traditional music, especially the very old or ancient songs...i love those majestic foggy towering mountains...it's like a home to my restless heart and soul...i have always wanted to live on top of a high mountain and touch the clouds and feel the soft sun rays nearer...i wish to live like a hermit or with few people in a community surrounded by vast nature and all the abundance of Mother nature's providence...
i really love how the chinese maintain the traditional medicine.  i really hope they continue to tap in more in that area.

I am a Massage Therapist.  I was introduced to TCM when I trained for my profession.  Accupuncture and Chine Herbal Medicine in TCM SAVED my life.  I pray that more people discover its benefit and that it lives on FOREVER.

I have a strong reason to say this... I LOVE THEM ALL AND LOVE CHINA AS ITS CULTURE AND TRADITIONS most of which are still kept and practiced today. Why do I say this?... Because I have been living in China since 2012, and my very first city I was Blessed to arrive when I met my beautiful girlfriend, it's the most ancient and beautiful first Capital of China, Luoyang City in Henan Province. And my father-in-law. Mr. Zhou Ji is an old ancient Acupuncture Doctor, still practicing and giving thousand of free treatments to most people in his city and neighboring villages. Blessings are with everyone.

Very cool. I had my own profound experiences of acupuncture over forty years ago. Now I do my humble best to share with others what I've learned. I recommend everyone study and practice chi-kung,  not just for eight months, but every day for life. It is beneficial for all ailments, but the patient must practice chi-kung as well. It is as close to a panacea as you will ever find. The patient must take an active interest in not continuing those bad habits which cause an imbalance of the chi in the first place. Find balance in your life and be well.

I had 10 sessions of acupuncture to release and heal a frozen shoulder and I did not feel any pain at all when the needles went in. There was a tingling sensation but it was not pain. There was only one point, by my knee, that I had to ask for the needle to be removed. It was not painful but the sensation was very unpleasant. The doctor agreed that it was a very 'strong' point and she removed the needle for me. The rest of the points were in the hand, arm and upper back and they were no problem at all. She also gave me a brisk massage with a special alcohol rub with herbs in and I had to take some herbal pills for a few weeks. The treatment cured the problem.
I've used it for many years and it is very effective in terms of remedy. This was a fascinating documentary.
